entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (16)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (16)20150920
I did all of Yahar'gul, which was very tense because of the Chime
Maidens. I died on my first attack on the One Reborn, but beat it
the next time very quickly. I hid in the stairwell and went out to
do an attack or two. When I was at about 50% health, I used a Bolt
Paper and destroyed it. After that I went to the Orphanage, which
was very tense also because of the Brain Suckers. I beat the
Celestial Emissary on the first try and wasted a Bolt Paper on
it. After that I tried many many time to beat Ebrietas, but kept
dying. Eventually I finally did it by drastically changing my
armor setup, going with the untransformed Holy Blade, and goading
it into the entry hallway so it wouldn't have as much
maneuverability. This was one of the hardest fights I've had so
far. After that I explored the rest of the Lecture Building and
entered the last Nightmare. I think I may be able to beat the game
tonight when I play.

Total time: 30:34
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (15)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (15)20150919
I did all of Bygernwerth, although it was really short so that
isn't saying much. I defeated Rom on my second try and mainly
focused on carefully killing off spiders then going in for charged
R2 attacks with Ludwig's Holy Blade. It was fairly easy. After
that I killed Master Willem and then finished Eileen's quest. For
that hunter, I cheesed him by getting him to poison himself and
carefully dodge in and out. I see the end of the game in sight!

Total time: 26:59
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (14)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (14)20150916
I played for about two hours and went through all of Cainhurst
Castle. I found the weird spider monsters outside to be really
challenging, but all the monsters inside were really easy. I went
back to the Dream at the shortcut point to restock. I beat the
boss after about four tries. I started trying to be very careful
but it didn't work well. In the last time, I was really aggressive
and did lots of stunning and visceral attacks. Each visceral
attack did over 1000 damage, which was pretty awesome. After I did
that, I finished Alfred's Quest line and got those two Runes.

Total time: 25:31
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Book: His Majesty's Dragon, by Naomi Novik (2006) (3)
entry.content:
Book: His Majesty's Dragon, by Naomi Novik (2006) (3)20150916
I finished this book today. I love the idea of Napoleon going
across the Channel with flying airships. I really liked how
Temeraire was so useful there at the end. It was an organic way to
make him "the one" without being incredibly "Mary Sue" about
it. I'm excited for future books.
  • Books
  • 2006

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (13)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (13)20150914
I explored the rest of the Woods and fought the bosses. I beat
them on the first try, which was pretty cool, and quite a bit
tense. In the Woods, I only died one time when I was attacked by
the magic using Celestials. The main problem was that I thought
there was only one of them, so I depleted my stamina by the time
the other attacked. I didn't lose any resources though, which was
nice.

Total time: 23:38
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015
